definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: Build a Barracks on your plateau and bring Kalkas to Thessaly.
sentences.chinese: 在高原建立一個兵營，把卡爾加帶到狄瑟利。

sentences.english: Their mission will be to support combat operations as an artillery battalion. (Logan Mock-Bunting/Getty Images)
sentences.chinese: 他們的任務是支援一個炮兵營的作戰。

sentences.english: The barracks stand on the site of the old castle.
sentences.chinese: 那個兵營位於古城堡的舊址上。

sentences.english: Build a Barracks on your plateau.
Build a Barracks and Temple on your plateau.
sentences.chinese: 在高原建立一個兵營和寺廟。

sentences.english: The grass around the barracks was dark and sticky with human blood.
sentences.chinese: 兵營四周的草地淹沒在黏膩的人血裏。

sentences.english: Build a Barracks and a Settlement on your plateau and bring Kalkas to Thessaly.
sentences.chinese: 在高原建立一個兵營，把卡爾加帶到狄瑟利。

sentences.english: I hated that camp; they always routed us up at day break .
sentences.chinese: 我討厭那個兵營，他們總是天剛亮就把我們鬧起牀。

sentences.english: Those paratroopers are sitting in the cantonment film theater to see a movie.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們坐在兵營的電影院裏看一部電影。

sentences.english: I know, but it's hard to fit a piano in a foxhole.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，但在這散兵營，你壓根找不着鋼琴來合奏。

sentences.english: José declares his love, but says he must return to the barracks.
sentences.chinese: 賀塞向卡門表明愛意，但他必須重返兵營。

sentences.english: Top of the barracks, fell is a turning point.
sentences.chinese: 阿齊齊亞兵營的失守是一個轉折點。

sentences.english: The missile destroyed an American Army barracks.
sentences.chinese: 導彈摧毀了一個美軍兵營。

sentences.english: It serves as a prerequisite for Reapers to be built at the Barracks.
sentences.chinese: 兵營是雙槍老大爺的前提建築之一。

sentences.english: We destroyed the railway line to prevent the supplies from coming upto the enemy camp.
sentences.chinese: 爲了切斷給敵軍兵營的給養運輸，我們破壞了鐵路。

definition: mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
internal affairs/domestic affairs/family affairs/(trad.) affairs within the palace
a scholar or government official living in one's village/a village gentleman/squire
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
